text:
AuthenticThai food in this area, try it, and the portion can share~ Generally, the dishes I bought below are shared among 2 pax, which is pretty filling and recommends it!

>> Pineapple Fried Rice ($5.50)
I can eat pineapple bits, prawn, egg, mixed vege, and pork floss. Honestly, it is a nice amount of ingredients as I do have a bad experience of having pineapple fried rice with pathetic pineapple bits only. Moreover, this was shared between 2 pax.

>> Tom Yum Soup ($6.50)
Good portion of seafood, which personally I felt worth the price, do try it! The herbs used are not stingy at all~ Aroy~

Value for money and good quality.
Be prepared to queue on weeknights.
The estimate waiting time the Aunty provided is accurate- they wont overpromise.

Authentic Thai food in food court. The only one I know.

Ordered basil pork rice,
Kai lan
Fried noodles n
Tom yam.

Food taste is superb put some sg restaurant to shame.

Service is great too, she bring the food to your table. Which usually only happens for Zi char.

Total bill $23. Where to find?

2nd time with the stall and it continues to impress me - authentically tasty food, generous portions at affordable prices. This was the first time I had Thai olive fried rice in a hawker centre and it was really good. Would certainly recommend this to friends looking for accessible, good Thai food. No issues with the auntie on both occasions.

Have been going to this stall for years, love their Pad Thai & Tom Yum soup. Taste is authentic, portion is generous and good quality for the price paid. The lady taking order is never rude, and she always remembers I donâ€™t want chili powder for my Pad Thai even after months of not eating there!
